title: Ensure that circuits svg has width/height 100%
body: This PR simply sets `width` and `height` to `auto` (defaults to 100% for svg elements) in the circuits svg, this way it is properly stretched to the viewport boundaries.

title: Update Time Travel feature with Vercel URLs
body:
Related to #37 

This PR should fix the Time Travel feature for the upcoming branches/PRs!

I've took the liberty of updating the great initial work from @cowshedtech, with template strings and added an event listener to wait for the DOM to be ready before executing the `lastPr()` call.

Known issues:

- Older branches will not exist, as they were not built on Vercel at the time
- `SessionStorage` will throw an exception with the iframe requesting access to the theme color

Let me know what are your thoughts on this solution! :)

title: Baseline timetravel functionality which fixes #23

Uses github api to pull pr's and the [netlify preview functionality](https://www.netlify.com/blog/2016/07/20/introducing-deploy-previews-in-netlify/) to serve the pr which is served in an iframe ..

title: Browser uniformity
body: The svg circuit animations were previously only executed in chrome. In Safari and Firefox, the circuit svg lines rendered on screen load and then the nodes eased-in afterwards. Now in all three browsers the svg circuit lines will be drawn after page load and ease-in to mimic the animation seen in chrome.

title: Feature: Add Dark Mode Toggle
body: **What kind of change does this PR introduce?** Since we all love dark mode toggles I thought we should have one here too... But to make sure we ain't scaring people away let's default to the known dark mode 😄 - [x] ColorThemeSwitch which defaults to dark and saves it's settings to `localStorage` for recurring visits **What did change?** - [x] Fix some minor typography and responsiveness issues - [x] Abstract the CSS color definition a little bit to make it more themeable and also use vars instead of hardcoded colors across the css - [x] Inline JS Code was moved from HTML to the js file **What's in the pipeline/missing?** - [x] The Logo is a PNG and I'd like to avoid creating a second one for the `light mode` - any chance I could get an SVG version of the logo @jessfraz? (otherwise I go with the PNG approach) - [ ] I'd potentially like to rewrite it as a react app since it would enable us to create reusable components and many more things - but I guess we'd need @jessfraz commitment on this ;) **What is the current behavior/visual look?** **What is the new behavior/visual look?** **Checklist** - [ ] Documentation - [ ] Tests (ouch...) - [ ] Ready to be merged

title: Tighten up the layout
body:
This PR does the following (minor) things:

- Replaces the heading/title (and updates the description string) with the logo with link to https://oxide.computer/ 🤓
- Adds CSS variables because variables are nice ✨
- Adds animations because we like nice things ✨
- Adds Inter font because we like nice things (can revert if we really like HK Grotesk) ✨
- Adds script for contributor count because we are doing this together 🙌
- Fixes some general layout issues for narrow viewports 📱

## Before
![Oxide Computer Company_ Design](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24152/70201498-b17aab00-16cb-11ea-832f-c7e452b80c19.jpg)

## After
![oxide](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24152/70201514-b5a6c880-16cb-11ea-976f-372e147bec4a.gif)

title: Small improvements. Updated to latest code and fixed merged issues.
body:
User Case:
Send a PR with any improvement

Solution:
I am not a designer, but I wanted to add my small improvements to this.
I have taken into consideration to make the links accessible and use web safe colors. For more information about this please check: https://whocanuse.com/?b=3366FF&c=FFFFFF&f=20&s=
Extracting the colors and basic properties in a variables.css file makes it easier for later to modify all of them from one place only.

title: Modern centering & box-sizing
body:
User Case:
Send a PR with any improvement

Solution:
Bugged me that position absolute and translate was being used for centering, so I rewrote those bits with flexbox and viewwidth and viewheight units, which have been supported by almost all browsers since 2012-2013.

And I added box-sizing for reduced mental book keeping for sizes.

All this causes a slight move of the text on desktop due to the slight off centering it had initially, even with compensation.

title: Favicon improvements
body:
I made the favicon transparent to look better in dark mode, using a more neutral grey so it shows up over both dark and light. I also added a 32x32 version to the file to show up better on high-res screens.

Good luck building computers!

Here's a 196x196 png for reference because github doesn't seem to preview .ico files.
![196x196 icon](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/543668/69992448-8a22b300-14fe-11ea-9adf-8a4409c36681.png)

title: Use brand font
body:
I noticed the fonts are inconsistent on this page with the main site

I added the font file to this repo since it has an open source license

Also the grayscale antialiasing tends to work better for light text on dark backgrounds

(this isn't a job application, I just obsess about fonts, BUT I love what you're doing!)
